text: Vendôme is a commune in central French, and is a subprefecture in the Loir-et- Cher department. It is also the capital of the arrrondissement of Vendôme and the administrative centre of the Vendôme canton. Vendôme is one of the main towns along the Loir river. It is the third largest city of the department after Blois and Romorantin-Lanthenay. ==Geography== The city of Vendôme is along the Loir river. The commune has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Chinon to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Blois, the departmental capital - ; * Orléans - the regional capital ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Lyon - ; * Nantes - ; * Marseille - . Vendôme and its neighboring communes The commune of Vendôme is surrounded by the communes: ===Climate=== The Köppen climate classification type for the climate at Vendôme is an "Oceanic climate" (also known as Marine West Coast Climate) and of the subtype Cfb. The average amount of precipitation for the year in Vendôme is . The month with the most precipitation on average is October with of precipitation. The month with the least precipitation on average is February with an average of . The average temperature for the year in Vendôme is . The warmest month, on average, is July with an average temperature of . The coolest month on average is January, with an average temperature of . ==Population== The inhabitants of Vendôme are known, in French, as Vendômois (women: Vendômoises). With a population of 16,879, Vendôme has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is part of the intercommunality Territoires Vendômois (). === Twinned and partner towns === Vendôme is twinned with: * Gevelsberg, Germany, since 1965 ==Gallery== File:Vendome-ruines-du- chateau-dpt-Loir-et-Cher-DSC 0644.jpg|Ruins of the castle at Vendôme.
